paragraphs: Also on the daily podcast: an interview with the exiled leader of Belarus and face masks from a candy-floss machine
“If coal falls in the West but rises in Asia, you’ll blaze right past the Paris goals”—a dirty habit

IN THE WEST market forces are squeezing coal—even as its use rises in Asia. We examine how the world can wean itself off the dirtiest fossil fuel. Svetlana Tikhanovskaya, Belarus’s probable presidential-election winner, never expected to run for office. Our correspondent visits her in exile, asking about the country’s prospects for democracy. And how candy-floss machines may help make better face masks. Runtime: 21min
